strive_liaisons.description: STRIVE is a student-driven coalition that empowers all members of the Rice community to play an active role in eliminating gender-based inequality and sexual violence. We do this by engaging in positive, open dialogue, pooling on and off-campus resources, and providing the tools and skills necessary to create cultural change.

members.name: Karen Martinez Perez (she/her/hers)
members.bio: Hi, I'm one of the head RHAs at McMurtry this year! I love grabbing boba, going shopping, hugs, watching Studio Ghibli movies, and learning/practicing languages. Feel free to reach out about managing anxiety, imposter syndrome, relationships (romantic/platonic), confidence/self-esteem, burnout, and feeling lonely or homesick.

members.name: Sophia Peng (she/her/hers)
members.bio: Hi, I'm one of the head RHAs at McMurtry this year! I love writing poetry, reading, medical humanities, and thrift shopping. Feel free to reach out about social anxiety, loneliness, imposter syndrome, time management, insomnia, body image/body dysmorphia, or how to seek health resources!

RHAs.description: RHAs are students who have been trained on a variety of wellbeing topics. These students work at their college to provide health education opportunities, health supplies and peer guidance. RHAs also act as a liaison between the Student Wellbeing Office and the residential colleges, staying up to date on campus-wide wellbeing programming.

members.name: Brandon Zimmer (he/him/his)
members.bio: I love playing soccer and volleyball in my spare time. I also enjoy reading and watching the newest shows on Netflix. Feel free to reach out about any topics really, but I would say mental health especially!

members.name: Camille Villar (she/her/hers)
members.bio: I love to read, teach, and play video/board games :). Feel free to reach out about long-distance relationships (romantic + non-romantic), work-life balance, suicide (both suicidal thoughts + how to support loved ones)!

members.name: Zoe Wang (she/her/hers)
members.bio: Hello!! I love biking, finding local aesthetic matcha + coffee shops, planning picnics with friends, and recently, playing pickle ball. Feel free to reach out about mental health and wellbeing, ALLY, stress relief, suicide prevention, body acceptance, etc!

members.name: Manshi Patel (she/her/hers)
members.bio: I love watching Criminal Minds and bullet journaling! Feel free to reach out about imposter syndrome, mental health, or relationships!

members.name: Annika Nambiar (she/her/hers)
members.bio: I love reading, playing volleyball, and boardgames. Feel free to reach out about imposter syndrome, stress, relationships, and anything else!

members.name: Prathik Kalva (he/him/his)
members.bio: I love playing and watching sports, and in my free time, I like to hangout with my friends and eat food! Feel free to reach out about imposter syndrome, homesickness, sexual health, academic support

members.name: Ahalya Lettenberger (she/her/hers)
members.bio: I am on the swim team at Rice, and in my free time I love to do anything outdoors, golf, cook, and play board games with friends. Feel free to reach out about any physical or mental health questions!
